name: Chromatic Motel Photo Print
description:
Background: Sometimes my husband just drives me around until I find something I want to take a picture of. This particular motel north of Chicago was quite a treasure trove of the grand ole'l days of midcentury travel.

I'll be honest: these photo prints are maybe my favorite things I've ever made. They have turned out better than I could have ever imagined and provided a whole new avenue for me to share my photography work.

When you buy a photograph, it is like buying a window ~ a view into another world, another moment in time, a ticket for adventure that is beckoning you to join in. What makes these photograph especially unique is the transfer process used to print them onto wooden blocks. Even though I shoot digital, which means I could use a single image in multiple ways, each and every transfer turns out differently, so your print will be truly unique.

All photos are original works taken by me. They are transferred onto wooden blocks by hands using a gel medium process. This process results in a slightly distressed or vintage look. Due to how certain colors transfer, the wood grain is often visible through the image, adding a beautiful layer of texture.

 The wooden blocks are made by a fellow artist/crafter who turns his scrap wood into these beautiful wood blocks. Each image and the sides of the wooden blocks are protected with a sealant to increase water-resistance and durability.

This piece measures 8x8x1/2". There is a keyhole slot cut in the back for easy hanging.

You can more original photography here: www.jlwalther.com. Any photos from my website could be made into a photo-transfer print. Please contact me about a custom print!

name: Double-Dipped Grab Bag
description:
Looking for something to brighten up your home this winter? Do you like surprises? Try out a "grab bag" of double-dipped coasters! Each set will come with 4 coasters in either maple or elm in varying color-combinations. They're just enough color to make your pop and enough sparkle to keep spirits bright throughout the winter.

These "double-dipped" coasters are an original design. I start out with a raw wood slice, sand it several times by hand until it is completely smooth, then paint on one color and then another. Finally, each coaster is coated twice with a sealant (and sanded once more) to ensure maximum water resistance while also not harming your furniture.

Each coaster will measure about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. The elm comes from my aunt & uncle's farm in southern Indiana, where it was destined for the wood burner. All other wood slices are bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

If you're looking for a way to add a little color to your home, or need a unique gift, these coasters are the perfect way to protect your valuable furniture in style.

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

name: Coasters That Care
description:
Coasters, right? Seems old-fashioned…but not these coasters! Show your host or hostess how much you care about their furniture. Each coaster features an original design; there are 4 designs per set. These coasters will add a stylish touch to your next get-together and are also a great (and humorous) gift for a host or hostess.

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

These coasters are available maple. The maple measures about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. These slices were bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

I take custom orders! If you need coasters for a party or wedding or a specific gift, please contact me!

name: Coasters with a Purpose
description:
Coasters, right? Seems old-fashioned…but not these coasters! These coasters have a purpose: to Serve and Protect your furniture. Each coaster features an original design; there are 4 designs per set. These coasters will add a stylish touch to your next get-together and also some humor for your guests.

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

These coasters are available in maple. The maple measures about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. The maple was bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

These coasters work great as a gift for a host/hostess or housewarming. They are also sure to be a conversation starter at your next dinner or party. These coasters will not only protect your furniture in style, they'll also show your guests that coasters can be fun!

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

I take custom orders! If you need coasters for a party or wedding or a specific gift, please contact me!

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

These coasters are available in elm, in print or script. The elm slices are about 3 1/2" in diameter and 1/2" thick. The elm comes from my aunt & uncle's farm in southern Indiana, where it was destined for the wood burner.

name: Host & Hostess Set in Print
description:
Looking to spice up place settings at your next party or dinner? Need a gift for a housewarming or friend? These coasters are a stylish way to protect your furniture and humor your guests.

Each coaster features a different, original design in a sturdy block print: Host, Hostess, and 2 Guests.

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

These coasters are available in elm or sassafras. The sassafras measures about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. The elm slices are about 3 1/2" in diameter and 1/2" thick. The elm comes from my aunt & uncle's farm in southern Indiana, where it was destined for the wood burner. All other wood slices are bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

I take custom orders! If you need coasters for a party or wedding or a specific gift, please contact me!

name: Ode to Effie
description:
Well, with her love for mahogany, I couldn't make coasters and not remember Effie Trinket. For any Hunger Games fans out there…who also want to protect their mahogany furniture, these coasters are for you! Each coaster in this set features a different quote from Ms. Trinket herself.

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

These coasters are available in maple. Each slice measures about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. They were bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

I take custom orders! If you need coasters for a party or wedding or a specific gift, please contact me!

name: Good Manners in Script
description:
Do you miss the days of good manners? Want to teach your guests party etiquette without being an overbearing host(ess)? Why not just use these coasters to not only protect your furniture, but also humor your guests with a modern etiquette tip adapted from Emily Post herself?

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

These coasters are available in maple and elm. The maple measures about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. The elm slices are about 3 1/2" in diameter and 1/2" thick. The elm slices came from my aunt and uncle's farm in southern Indiana, where they were rescued from the wood-burning pile. All other slices were bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

I take custom orders! If you need coasters for a party or wedding or a specific gift, please contact me!

name: Good Manners in Print
description:

Adapted from Emily Post herself, each of these 4 coasters features a modern etiquette tip in a completely original design.

I start out with raw wood slices and sand them by hand several times until they are very smooth. I then transfer the design using a solvent, so that the wood soaks up the ink. Finally, each coaster is coated with a sealant, sanded one more time, and sealed again to ensure that they are water-resistant and won't scratch your furniture.

Finally, each coaster is coated twice with a sealant (and sanded once more) to ensure maximum water resistance while also not harming your furniture.

These coasters are available in both maple or elm. Both kinds measure about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. The elm comes from my aunt & uncle's farm in southern Indiana, where it was destined for the wood burner. All other wood slices are bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

If you're looking for a way to add a little color to your home, or need a unique gift, these coasters are the perfect way to protect your valuable furniture in style.

Because wood is a natural material, each and every wood slice turns out different. There are always natural "imperfections" that add personality and individuality to each piece. Photos are representative of each set, but your actual coasters may vary slightly.

name: Double Dipped Coasters in Mint & Silver
description:
Looking for something to brighten up your home this winter? How about just a *touch* of sparkle with these double-dipped coaster sets? Silver and minty-blue work together to provide some winter-glitz that will last long through the holidays.

These "double-dipped" coasters are an original design. I start out with a raw wood slice, sand it several times by hand until it is completely smooth, then paint on one color and then another. Finally, each coaster is coated twice with a sealant (and sanded once more) to ensure maximum water resistance while also not harming your furniture.

These coasters are available in both maple or elm. Both kinds measure about 3" in diameter and 1/4" thick. The elm comes from my aunt & uncle's farm in southern Indiana, where it was destined for the wood burner. All other wood slices are bought from fellow crafters/small business owners. I try to always buy from providers who use wood from fallen/damaged trees.

If you're looking for a way to add a little color to your home, or need a unique gift, these coasters are the perfect way to protect your valuable furniture in style.
